lines.content: Yale is a simple command-line chatbot designed to help users
manage tasks efficiently. Users can add, delete, mark, unmark, find and
list tasks. The chatbot supports ToDo, Deadline, and Event
tasks, and it stores tasks persistently in a file.
Description: Yale supports three types of tasks: ToDo, Deadline, and Event. Yale stores these type of tasks to a list.
Description: Adds a basic task without any date/time attached to it. First bracket will contain the letter "T"
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Description: Adds a task that need to be done before a specific date/time. First bracket will contain the letter "D"
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Description: Adds a task that start at a specific date/time and ends at a specific date/time. First bracket will contain the letter "E"
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Description: Displays all current tasks with their status (done or not done).
Here are the tasks in your list:
Description: Marks a task as completed by adding "X" in second bracket.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Description: Marks a task as uncompleted by removing "X" in second bracket.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Description: Removes a task from the list permanently.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Description: Find a task by searching for a keyword in the task description.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Description: Closes the chatbot and exits the program.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by The deadline of the task.
* Represents a task with a start and end time.
* Constructs an Event task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Parses user input and executes the corresponding commands.
* Parses the user input and executes the corresponding command.
* @param userInput The input provided by the user.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to operate on.
* @param ui The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage to save tasks after modifications.
* @throws YaleException If the user input is invalid or an error occurs during execution.
public static void parse(String userInput, TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws YaleException {
throw new YaleException("Index out of bounds");
throw new YaleException("Index out of bounds");
throw new YaleException("Description cannot be empty.");
throw new YaleException("Invalid deadline format. Follow: deadline <description> /by <date>");
Task task = new Event(description, from, to);
throw new YaleException("Invalid event format. Follow: event <description> /from <start> /to <end>");
throw new YaleException("Invalid task index. Please try again.");
throw new YaleException("Invalid command. Please type another command.");
* Handles loading tasks from a file and saving tasks to a file.
* Constructs a Storage object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.
this.filePath = Paths.get(filePath).toString(); // Ensures the file path is portable
* Initializes the storage file. Creates the file and its parent directories if they do not exist.
* Saves the list of tasks to the file.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to save.
line = taskType + " | " + status + " | " + task.getDescription() + " | " + ((Event) task).getFrom() + " | " + ((Event) task).getTo();
* Loads tasks from the file into the given task list.
* @param taskList The list to load tasks into.
taskList.add(task); // Add the task to TaskList
* Represents a task with a description and a completion status.
* Constructs a Task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, " " otherwise.
return "[" + getStatusIcon() + "]" + description; // Format: [X] read book
* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods to manage them.
* Adds a task to the list.
* Deletes a task from the list.
* @param index The index of the task to delete.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as done.
* Marks a task as not done.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as not done.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* Represents a task without a deadline or event time.
* Constructs a ToDo task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Handles interactions with the user, such as displaying messages and reading input.
* Constructs an Ui object and initializes the scanner for user input.
* Displays a welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Displays a goodbye message to the user.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Reads a command from the user.
* @return The user's input as a trimmed string.
* Displays an error message to the user.
* @param message The error message to display.
* Displays a loading error message to the user.
System.out.println("Error loading tasks from file. Starting with an empty task list.");
* Displays a message confirming that a task has been added.
* @param task The task that was added.
* @param taskCount The total number of tasks after adding.
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int taskCount) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskCount + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays the list of tasks to the user.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to display.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays a message confirming that a task has been marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a message confirming that a task has been marked as not done.
* @param task The task that was marked as not done.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays a message confirming that a task has been deleted.
* @param task The task that was deleted.
* @param taskCount The total number of tasks after deletion.
public void showTaskDeleted(Task task, int taskCount) {

* Represents the main class for the Yale chatbot.
* Handles the initialization of the application and the main execution loop.
* Constructs a Yale object with the specified file path for storage.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.
* Displays a welcome message and processes user commands until the user exits with the command "bye".
